description:
The **AWSSupport-TroubleshootPatchManagerLinux** runbook helps in evaluating and diagnosing failed executions of the **AWS-RunPatchBaseline** AWS Systems Manager document against Linux based AWS Systems Manager Managed Instances. AWS-RunPatchBaseline is the default SSM Document used by the Patch Manager. The runbook analyze the Patching logs present on the instance to find the cause of the failure and provide remediation steps for the errors found.

### Supported Operating Systems:
 - Amazon Linux 2 and 2023
 - Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.X and 9.X
 - Centos 8.X and 9.X
 - Ubuntu 18.04,20.04,22.04
 - SUSE 15.X
### Prerequisites:

- Instance must be Linux and SSM Managed.
- Following packages must be available on the instance : **python3.7 or later, wget or curl, unzip.** Note: We recommend upgrading to Python 3.8 or later to minimize impact of future update campaigns. Refer to this [public documentation](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/developer/python-support-policy-updates-for-aws-sdks-and-tools/) for more info on this. 
- Instance can connect to S3 service endpoints to download the code from AWS owned bucket **arn:aws:s3:::aws-ssm-document-attachments-region/***.

**Note**: The input parameter **RunCommandId** is optional. If you do not provide a specific Command ID to evaluate, automation looks for last unsuccessful execution of AWS-RunPatchBaseline for the instance. If you provide a command ID as the input, the Command ID must have been executed in last **30 days**. This is because the Run Command history retention period is 30 days.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Optional) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows Systems Manager Automation to perform the actions on your behalf. If no role is specified, Systems Manager Automation uses the permissions of the user that starts this runbook.

InstanceId.description: (Required) Provide the ID of the linux based SSM managed Node (EC2 or Hybrid Activated on-premise server) for which AWS-RunPatchBaseline document execution failed.

RunCommandId.description: (Optional) Failed Run Command ID of AWS-RunPatchBaseline. If not provided, automation looks for the latest unsuccessful execution of AWS-RunPatchBaseline for the instance and evaluate it. To confirm the command ID, look under Command History tab in the Run Command Console under AWS Systems Manager.

mainSteps.name: CheckConcurrency
mainSteps.description: Ensures there is only one execution of this runbook targeting the same Instance. If the runbook finds another in progress execution targeting the same Instance, it returns an error and ends.

mainSteps.name: ValidateCommandID
mainSteps.description: Validates if RunCommandId is provided as input parameter. If not, finds the latest execution of AWS-RunPatchBaseline for the Instance which is in Failed status.

import boto3
from botocore.exceptions import ClientError

ERROR_ICON = " \u274C [ERROR]:"
INFO_ICON = " \u2705 [INFO]:"
WARN_ICON = " \u274E [WARNING]:"

try:
    ssm_client = boto3.client("ssm")
except ClientError as e:
    raise Exception(f"{ERROR_ICON} Failed to initialize boto3 client for service ssm. {str(e)}")


def script_handler(events, context=None):
    instance_id = events["Instance"]
    command_id = events["CommandID"]

    if command_id:
        try:
            response = ssm_client.get_command_invocation(CommandId=command_id, InstanceId=instance_id)
            documentname = response["DocumentName"]
            if documentname != "AWS-RunPatchBaseline":
                raise Exception(
                    f"{ERROR_ICON} Command ID {command_id} was not executed for AWS-RunPatchBaseline SSM Document.Exiting.."
                ) from None
            status = response["StatusDetails"]
            if status in [
                "AccessDenied",
                "ExecutionTimedOut",
                "DeliveryTimedOut",
                "Undeliverable",
                "Failed",
                "Success",
                "Terminated",
                "Cancelled",
            ]:
                return {"command": command_id, "status": status}
            else:
                raise Exception(f"{ERROR_ICON} Command ID {command_id} has an Unknown Failed Status..") from None
        except ClientError as e:
            raise Exception(f"{ERROR_ICON} Failed to call the GetCommandInvocation API: {str(e)}")

    try:
        print(
            f"{INFO_ICON} No RunCommandID provided. Looking for Latest execution of AWS-RunPatchBaseline SSM Document for the instance.\n "
        )
        response = ssm_client.list_command_invocations(
            InstanceId=instance_id,
            Filters=[{"key": "DocumentName", "value": "AWS-RunPatchBaseline"}],
        )

        commandslist = response.get("CommandInvocations", [])
        status_filter = [
            "Failed",
            "AccessDenied",
            "ExecutionTimedOut",
            "DeliveryTimedOut",
            "Undeliverable",
            "Terminated",
        ]
        filtered_commandslist = [item for item in commandslist if item.get("Status") in status_filter]

        if filtered_commandslist:
            latestcommand_id_dict = max(filtered_commandslist, key=lambda x: x["RequestedDateTime"])
            latest_command_id = latestcommand_id_dict["CommandId"]
            status = latestcommand_id_dict["StatusDetails"]
            print(
                f"{INFO_ICON} Found unsuccessful latest execution of AWS-RunPatchBaseline SSM Document for {instance_id} with {status} status with command ID:{latest_command_id}\n"
            )
            return {"command": latest_command_id, "status": status}
        else:
            raise Exception(
                f"{ERROR_ICON} No failed patch command id found for {instance_id}. Rerun this Automation and provide the Run Command ID associated with Failed execution of AWS-RunPatchBaseline to debug."
            ) from None
    except ClientError as e:
        raise Exception(f"{ERROR_ICON} Failed to list commands for {instance_id} : {str(e)}")
